title: Aluminum Market Navigates Volatility as China's Output Concerns Meet Mixed Industrial Demand
summary: Global aluminum prices are experiencing significant volatility due to concerns about China's production capacity and mixed signals from global industrial demand. Despite a recent price drop to $2,862.40 per tonne, supply constraints from China support prices, while forecasts suggest potential dips early in 2026 but a generally firm-to-rising price environment.

title: Aluminum price falls to one-month low in wider commodity slump
summary: Aluminum prices dropped to a one-month low of $2,526 per ton on the London Metal Exchange amid a broader commodity slump and anticipation of the Federal Reserve's interest rate decision. Despite short-term declines, longer-term trends remain bullish due to expected production slowdowns in China and rising input costs.

title: Aluminum Prices Hit 3-Year High: Is It the Next Key Metal in the Clean Energy Shift?
summary: Aluminum prices surged to a three-year high around $2,800 per tonne driven by rising demand from electric vehicles, solar, and grid upgrades. Supply constraints from China's power shortages and environmental regulations, along with geopolitical risks in bauxite supply, are tightening the market and boosting prices for low-carbon aluminum.

title: LME cash aluminium slips 0.03% to $2,858/t as futures extend gains
summary: The London Metal Exchange cash aluminum price slightly declined by 0.03% to $2,858 per tonne, while futures prices extended gains. This minor slip reflects ongoing market fluctuations amid broader base metals volatility.

title: Aluminum prices surged to their highest level since May 2022
summary: Aluminum prices rose 0.9% to $2,909.50 per ton on the London Metal Exchange, marking the highest level since May 2022. The rally is supported by a base metals market upswing and eased US-China trade tensions.

title: Aluminum Market Navigates Volatility as China's Output Concerns Meet Mixed Industrial Demand
summary: China's aluminum production is nearing its annual capacity cap of 45 million tons, limiting growth to about 2% in 2025 and 0.7% in 2026. This constraint, combined with global environmental regulations and supply chain challenges such as potential sanctions on Russian aluminum, is creating a supply squeeze amid rising demand from green energy sectors like electric vehicles and solar energy.

title: Aluminum - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News - Trading Economics
summary: Aluminum prices fell slightly on December 2, 2025, but futures are up over 10% for the year due to supply decreases. China's production cap of 45 million tons and setbacks in new smelter projects in Indonesia, along with disruptions like equipment failure at Iceland’s Grundartangi smelter, are tightening supply. Alcoa announced closure of its Kwinana alumina refinery due to deteriorating ore grades.

title: Aluminum Prices Hit 3-Year High: Is It the Next Key Metal in the Clean Energy Shift?
summary: Aluminum prices surged to a three-year high around $2,800 per tonne driven by strong demand from electric vehicles, solar, and grid upgrades. Supply constraints stem from China's power shortages, new environmental regulations limiting coal-powered smelting, and geopolitical risks affecting bauxite supply. Investment in renewable-powered smelting is increasing globally to meet demand for low-carbon aluminum.

title: US primary aluminum growth a 'function of energy'
summary: US aluminum production is influenced heavily by energy costs and availability. Despite tariffs intended to boost domestic smelting, only two of four US primary aluminum smelters operate at full capacity. Century Aluminum is investing $50 million to restart idled production, aiming for full capacity by mid-2026. The US smelter capacity utilization was only 52% in 2024 due to high electricity prices and other challenges.

title: Aluminum price hits three-year high as US-China truce buoys outlook
summary: Aluminum prices reached their highest level since May 2022, supported by China's production cap and easing US-China trade tensions. The rally reflects tightening supply and improving demand in construction and consumer goods. However, risks remain due to slowing momentum in China's economy and ongoing manufacturing declines.

title: Alcoa, Ball and Unilever Partner to Launch the First Use of ELYSIS Carbon-Free Smelting Technology in Consumer Personal and Home Care Packaging
summary: Alcoa, Ball, and Unilever have collaborated to introduce aluminum produced using ELYSIS carbon-free smelting technology in consumer packaging. This technology eliminates direct greenhouse gas emissions by generating oxygen instead of CO2 during smelting. The new aerosol can combines 50% ELYSIS primary aluminum with 50% recycled content, representing one of the lowest-carbon packaging solutions available and showcasing cross-industry collaboration for sustainability.

title: Novelis Wins German Ecodesign Award for Recycled Aluminium Automotive Sheet
summary: Novelis received the German Ecodesign Award for its innovative aluminum alloy made with 100% recycled end-of-life automotive scrap. The alloy, Novelis Advanz™ 6F – e170RC, contains at least 75% recycled content and is commercially available for exterior automotive applications. This achievement demonstrates the feasibility of true car-to-car aluminum recycling, significantly reducing CO2 emissions and advancing circular economy goals in the automotive industry.

title: Aluminum Market Navigates Volatility as China's Output Concerns Meet Mixed Industrial Demand
summary: The aluminum industry is experiencing volatility driven by China's production limits and mixed demand signals. A key trend is the growing adoption of green aluminum production, emphasizing renewable energy sources and advanced recycling technologies. Certification schemes like the Aluminium Stewardship Initiative are pushing the industry toward lower carbon footprints, while innovation, supply chain resilience, and regionalization are becoming critical for sustainable growth.

title: December Steel Price Outlook: Macro & Fundamental Drivers
summary: Steel prices have been volatile recently with slight declines in hot metal production but remain high. Inventory is expected to continue declining in December, though destocking pace for sheets and plates will be slow. Macro factors such as domestic policy meetings may support limited price increases despite persistent destocking pressure.

title: Iron ore edges up as steel price optimism outweighs softer hot metal output
summary: Iron ore futures rose slightly driven by optimism over stronger steel prices despite softer hot metal output. Chinese steel prices are expected to increase in December due to improved macroeconomic conditions and recovering market fundamentals. Environmental inspections are reducing pig iron production, pressuring raw materials.

title: Steel prices hit five-year low; weak trend likely to persist in near term
summary: Domestic steel prices in India have fallen to a five-year low amid rising imports and weak demand. High inventories and seasonal weakness are expected to keep prices subdued in the near term, with potential production cuts if prices correct further. The government is discussing import issues to support domestic steel competitiveness.

title: Final Thoughts - Steel Market Update
summary: Steel price hikes that began in November are continuing into December, with US producers like Nucor and Canadian mills raising prices due to low imports, lower inventories, and longer lead times. However, the price spread between hot-rolled and galvanized steel remains narrow, limiting converter margins.

title: American steel producers are gradually raising prices for rolled products
summary: US steel producers have increased prices for rolled steel products, with #4 rebar prices rising to $870-910 per short ton. This reflects ongoing price increases in the US market amid supply constraints and demand dynamics.

title: US raw steel production is down 1.4 percent - week 49, 2025
summary: According to the American Iron and Steel Institute (AISI), US domestic raw steel production for the week ending November 29, 2025, was 1.736 million net tons with a capacity utilization rate of 75.8 percent. Production decreased 1.4 percent from the previous week but increased 7.7 percent compared to the same period last year. Year-to-date adjusted production through November 29, 2025, reached 82.394 million net tons, up 3.3 percent from the previous year.

title: Canada's Algoma Steel to Cut 1,000 Jobs Amid US Tariffs
summary: Canadian steelmaker Algoma Steel Group Inc. announced it will lay off 1,000 workers and close its blast furnace and coke operations in Sault Ste. Marie due to US tariffs. The company reported a 13 percent sales drop and C$89.7 million in third quarter tariff costs, with the US steel market becoming largely closed to Canadian producers. Algoma plans to transition fully to electric-arc furnace production by early 2026, with layoffs taking effect on March 23.

title: Tough as steel
summary: US Steel, following its acquisition by Japan-based Nippon, plans to invest $3 billion in Arkansas to build a direct reduced iron plant and manufacture grain-oriented steel for transformers and electric motors. Nucor continues to operate at full capacity with a robust pipeline of new projects, while Hybar's scrap metal recycling steel production mill will produce over 700,000 tons annually of reinforcing bar.

title: Japan's Steel Sector Needs to Use All Low-Carbon Pathways to Reach Emissions Goal
summary: Japan's steel sector, responsible for about 13 percent of the country's emissions, must cut emissions from coal-based production to achieve its 2050 net zero goal. Scrap-based electric arc furnaces powered by renewable energy can produce steel at around $720 per ton by 2030, only 18 percent costlier than traditional blast furnace methods but with zero emissions. Japan could lower emissions by maximizing production at existing scrap-EAFs and implementing policies to redirect exported scrap volumes to domestic steel production.

title: National hub to cut steel production emissions
summary: A national initiative to make steel production greener and more sustainable has launched at Monash University, bringing together researchers and industry partners to develop smarter, low-emission steelmaking processes. The ARC Research Hub for Smart Process Design and Control will use simulation, AI, and industrial testing to transform steelmaking and train future engineers for a low-emission industrial economy.

title: Japan's Steel Sector Needs to Use All Low-Carbon Pathways to Reach Emissions Goal
summary: Japan's steel industry must leverage all available low-carbon pathways—including scrap-based electric arc furnaces, hydrogen, and carbon capture—to meet its 2050 net-zero target. BloombergNEF's report highlights that scrap-EAF powered by renewables could be cost-competitive by 2030, while hydrogen and CCS remain more expensive until 2050.

title: Breakthrough Technology Conference 2025
summary: The second Breakthrough Technology Conference is underway in Singapore, focusing on technologies that can significantly reduce CO2 emissions from steelmaking, such as hydrogen reduction, carbon capture, and reuse. The event highlights the urgency for innovation as the steel industry works to meet global climate goals.

title: Mitsui to Invest in EVERSTEEL – Developer and Supplier of AI-based Steel Scrap Analysis Systems
summary: Mitsui is investing in EVERSTEEL to advance AI-based steel scrap analysis systems, supporting decarbonization by improving scrap quality control and streamlining feedstock procurement. The collaboration aims to enhance the competitiveness and sustainability of the steel industry.

title: Copper Rises to 4-Month High
summary: Copper futures rose above $5.2 per pound, reaching their highest level in four months due to tight supply and elevated premiums. Supply constraints include lower output in Chile, planned cuts by Chinese smelters, and a weaker dollar, with markets anticipating a possible Federal Reserve rate cut.

title: Kamoa-Kakula Mine Copper Smelter to Begin Feeding LME; Copper Fluctuated and Closed Lower Overnight
summary: LME copper prices fluctuated significantly, opening at $11,205.5/mt and closing lower at $11,145/mt, down 0.78%. Spot premiums in Shanghai increased, while imported copper prices showed slight increases, reflecting mixed market dynamics amid ongoing supply and demand adjustments.

title: Comex Copper Settles 1.11% Lower at $5.1610 — Data Talk
summary: Front month Comex copper for December delivery fell 1.11% to $5.1610 per pound, snapping a four-session winning streak. Despite the decline, copper remains up nearly 30% year-to-date, reflecting strong gains since its 52-week low earlier in 2025.

title: Copper Prices Retreat Amid China Demand Concerns
summary: Copper prices edged down from recent record highs due to signs of softer demand from China, the world's largest copper consumer. Reduced seasonal demand from Chinese fabricators and a drop in the Yangshan copper premium suggest increased availability of Chinese metal for export, potentially easing global supply tightness.

title: Copper prices hit new record high
summary: Copper prices reached a new record high driven by a tense market with supply chain challenges and uncertainty over US tariffs. Prices rose on London and New York futures markets amid growing demand and large shipments to the US, as traders await clarity on import duties.

title: Copper pulls back from peak; market focus on upcoming Fed rate decision
summary: Copper prices consolidated after pulling back from a record high as markets focused on the upcoming US Federal Reserve interest rate decision. Despite a slight retreat, copper remains near peak levels supported by supply concerns and expectations of a Fed rate cut in December.

title: Copper retreats from peak on firmer dollar
summary: Benchmark three-month copper on the London Metal Exchange fell 0.4% to $11,207 per metric ton after hitting a recent peak, pressured by a firmer US dollar. The price retreat reflects profit-taking amid ongoing market volatility.

title: Kamoa-Kakula Mine Copper Smelter to Begin Feeding
summary: The 500,000 mt/year Phase 1 copper smelter at the Kamoa-Kakula mine officially started production on November 21, 2025, and is expected to begin feeding the first batch of copper concentrates before the end of the year. LME copper closed at $11,145/mt, down 0.78%, with the market experiencing considerable fluctuations throughout the trading session.

title: Copper Prices Retreat Amid China Demand Concerns
summary: Copper prices have edged down from recent record highs as softer demand from China, the world's largest copper consumer, is expected to increase availability of Chinese metal for export and ease global supply pressures. The Yangshan copper premium has fallen to its lowest level since July, signaling reduced appetite for imported metal within the Chinese market.

title: Amerigo's Minera Valle Central Receives Prestigious 2025 Circular Awards in Chile
summary: Amerigo Resources' Minera Valle Central (MVC) received a 2025 Circular Award for its Energy and Environmental Liabilities Transformation project, which recovers copper and molybdenum from tailings while improving energy efficiency. The project converts environmental liabilities into valuable assets by using tailings as production input, reducing energy consumption, emissions, and natural resource use through state-of-the-art technology and circular economy principles.

title: Rewiring Sustainable, Clean Energy Future With Copper
summary: The article highlights copper's critical role in enabling the global energy transition, with the International Energy Agency projecting copper demand for clean energy could nearly double by 2050. It emphasizes copper's 100% recyclability, with nearly 80% of all copper ever mined still in use today, and notes that nearly one-third of global copper demand is met through recycling, supporting sustainability and the circular economy.

title: Copper's Descent: A Stronger Dollar and Faltering Demand Drag Down the Red Metal
summary: The article discusses copper market challenges as of December 2, 2025, including price pressures from a stronger dollar and faltering demand, while highlighting opportunities in renewable energy infrastructure and the need for strategic adaptations. It emphasizes that copper mining companies must accelerate exploration and embrace new extraction technologies alongside sustainable practices, while consumers should invest in recycling technologies and supply chain optimization.

title: [SMM Nickel Midday Review] Nickel prices fluctuated rangebound amid macro pressures
summary: Nickel prices showed short-term fluctuations with lingering long-term pressure. The most-traded SHFE nickel contract settled slightly up at around 117,790 yuan/mt, with spot prices averaging 119,900 yuan/mt. Market sentiment is influenced by a weaker US manufacturing PMI and expectations of a US Fed interest rate cut in December.

title: Nickel price hits 4-year low as gloom offsets potential Indonesia cuts
summary: Nickel prices dropped to a four-year low due to a pessimistic outlook from the US Federal Reserve, despite Indonesia's consideration of deep mining quota cuts. Futures on the London Metal Exchange fell as much as 2.3%, with nickel trading near $15,235 per ton. The market is affected by expectations of fewer interest rate cuts and a stronger dollar, which increase financing costs and pressure commodity prices.

title: Indonesia's Nickel Supply & The Global Price Slump - What the Market Sell-Off Signals for Investors
summary: Nickel prices have fallen near a four-year low around $14,550 per tonne due to oversupply from Indonesia's refinery expansion, despite announced quota cuts. LME inventories surged by 90,000 tonnes in 2025, reinforcing market skepticism about effective supply tightening. While electric vehicle demand supports long-term nickel use, current oversupply dominates near-term price weakness.

title: LME nickel price rebounds above $14,900 on weak US dollar expectations
summary: Nickel prices on the London Metal Exchange closed at $14,928 per ton, rising by $99 and continuing a weekly increase after three months of declines. The rebound is attributed to expectations of a weaker US dollar, although supply concerns remain.

title: Nornickel maintains 2025 nickel production forecast
summary: Russia’s Nornickel, one of the world’s largest nickel producers, maintained its 2025 nickel production outlook at 196,000-204,000 metric tons. Nickel production rose 18% in Q3 2025 due to higher volumes of processed raw materials, despite earlier shipment cuts caused by seasonal flooding and equipment replacement challenges.

title: United Tractors sets up nickel-processing subsidiary
summary: PT United Tractors Tbk has established a new nickel-focused subsidiary, PT Nusantara Industri Nikel Lestari (NINL), as part of its diversification into nickel processing and services. The subsidiary was approved on December 2, 2025, and will operate in non-ferrous metal manufacturing and trading.

title: Vale to hit upper end of 2025 output target, cuts 2026 estimate
summary: Vale expects to reach the upper end of its 2025 nickel output target, alongside copper production targets. However, the company has revised down its production estimates for 2026. The 2025 nickel output target is approximately 175 million tonnes.

title: South32 completes sale of nickel refinery to CoreX Holding
summary: South32 has completed the sale of its nickel refinery to CoreX Holding, marking a significant transaction in the nickel processing sector. The sale aligns with South32's strategic portfolio adjustments.

title: Renforth Collaborates with CTRI to assess sustainability opportunities at Victoria nickel polymetallic open pit deposit
summary: Renforth is partnering with CTRI to investigate three green mining initiatives at the Victoria nickel deposit, including carbon sequestration by ultramafic rocks, alternative heap leach processes using organic acids and bioleaching, and nickel bioaccumulating plants as exploration tools. The collaboration aims to implement innovative green science and technology to meet both environmental and economic objectives at the new project.

title: Ironic Metals secures funding to decarbonise iron and nickel production
summary: Ironic Metals has secured funding to advance decarbonization efforts in iron and nickel production. The company is working on technologies to reduce carbon emissions in the production of these critical metals.

title: Breakthrough Tech Yields 99% Pure Nickel, Cobalt
summary: A UNIST research team has developed an innovative electrochemical recycling technology that recovers over 95% of nickel and cobalt from waste batteries with purity exceeding 99.9%. The sustainable method uses a multifunctional special solvent and eliminates the need for harsh chemicals and multi-stage processes, addressing limitations of conventional wet recycling.

title: Mining companies make stunning discovery that could be crucial for sustainable nickel extraction
summary: Allonia and Lundin Mining are testing D-Solve technology at Eagle Mine in Michigan, which uses microbes to selectively dissolve unwanted minerals and increase nickel purity by reducing magnesium impurities by 40% while increasing nickel grade by 18%. This breakthrough could transform mineral mining by decreasing costs and reducing environmental impact while meeting growing global nickel demand.

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali: 94% of the energy used comes from renewable sources and 93% of employees have permanent contracts
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali released its first Group Sustainability Report, highlighting that over 94% of the electricity used by the Group came from certified renewable sources by the end of 2024. The report also emphasizes strong social performance with 93% of employees having permanent contracts, positioning the company at the forefront of the Italian steel industry's sustainability efforts.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Greenland Resources Signs MOU With Italian Cogne for Molybdenum Supply
summary: Greenland Resources Inc. signed a non-binding memorandum of understanding with Cogne Acciai Speciali for long-term molybdenum supply. The agreement sets the path for a long-term supply agreement of Ferromolybdenum and Mo-oxide with extraction in Greenland and roasting in Belgium.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Tenaris hosts panel on nuclear energy and Italy's boilermaking future
summary: Tenaris hosted a panel discussion in Italy focusing on the strategic role of nuclear energy in Europe's energy transition and Italy's boilermaking industry. The event highlighted advances in nuclear technologies and Tenaris's accreditation to supply certified materials for nuclear facilities, emphasizing quality and safety standards.

title: Tenaris Acquires isOplus Oil and Gas Division in $10M Deal, Expands Pipe Coating Business
summary: Tenaris acquired the oil and gas division of isOplus for $10 million, gaining ownership of pre-insulated pipeline systems and anti-corrosion coatings in Europe. The acquired business was rebranded as Tenaris Coating Italy, enhancing Tenaris's offshore market offerings and enabling coating application at multiple global facilities.

title: Tenaris remains profitable in 2025
summary: Tenaris reported a $37 million profit in Q3 2025, a 15.6% increase from the previous quarter despite a year-over-year decline. Sales in North America remained steady, with some impacts from tariff increases and fluctuating drilling activity, but overall margins held up well.

title: Tenaris reduced pipe sales to 2.95 million tons in January-September
summary: Tenaris sold 2.95 million tons of pipe products in the first nine months of 2025, marking a 2% decrease compared to the same period in 2024.

title: Prysmian Awarded The Italy-Tunisia Interconnection
summary: Prysmian has been awarded the tender by Terna S.p.A. and STEG for the construction of a submarine power interconnection between Italy and Tunisia as part of the Elmed Project. The contract could reach a value of around €460 million and involves laying a power cable between Sicily and Tunisia at depths up to 800 meters, enhancing energy security between Europe and Africa.

title: Prysmian Lifts 2025 Outlook After Q3 Beat on Strong Transmission Growth
summary: Prysmian raised its full-year 2025 guidance after reporting third-quarter revenue of €5.03 billion, exceeding expectations due to strong growth in Renewable Transmission and Power Grids segments. The company highlighted a stable high-voltage backlog of about €16 billion and noted that copper tariffs could benefit them more in 2026.

title: World's Top Cable Maker Sees US Copper Tariff as Opportunity
summary: Prysmian, the world's largest copper cable maker, views the US 50% copper tariff as an opportunity to strengthen the American supply chain. The company benefits from sourcing a large part of its copper domestically and expects the tariff to reinforce local players' leadership in the market.

title: Prysmian Raises Annual Targets After Record Q3 Performance
summary: Following a historically strong third quarter, Prysmian raised its full-year 2025 guidance. The company’s growth is supported by increased demand in transmission and power grids, with ongoing investments in copper cable production and electrification projects.
